intro: Gymnosporia senegalensis f. macranthogera, commonly known as the large-flowered Gymnosporia, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, often growing in savanna and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant morphology and ecology.
